steps.content:
What is a Static Website?

Static websites are popular because they are super efficient, extremely fast and usually free to host. Blogs, resumes, marketing websites, landing pages, and documentation are all good candidates for static websites.

Follow along as we visually walk-through the differences and benefits between a static vs dynamic website.
steps.title: What is a Static Website?

steps.content: Static websites serve content directly from the web-server's file-system exactly as stored.
steps.title: Static websites serve content directly from the web-server's file-system exactly as stored.

steps.content:
Dynamic websites generate content live per each request

The request is delegated to a running web-application that builds the content.
steps.title: Dynamic websites generate content live per each request

steps.content:
WordPress is a popular dynamic web-application framework written in PHP

WordPress is installed on your website's hosting server and needs PHP and a MySQL database to run.
steps.title: WordPress is a popular dynamic web-application framework written in PHP

steps.content:
WordPress sends web requests to templates responsible for generating web pages on demand

The templates may be coded in PHP and/or other templating languages.
steps.title: WordPress sends web requests to templates responsible for generating web pages on demand

steps.content:
Templates execute conditional logic, access other files, and make database queries to generate the final page content

The more code, files, and database queries required the more expensive it is for your server.
steps.title: Templates execute conditional logic, access other files, and make database queries to generate the final page content

steps.content:
WordPress can be sped up using the WP Super Cache plugin

The WP Super Cache plugin works with the web-server to completely bypass the WordPress application environment. Requests are much faster because PHP is no longer executed nor is the database queried.
steps.title: WordPress can be sped up using the WP Super Cache plugin

steps.content:
WP Super Cache works by using WordPress to pre-build every page of your website

Instead of WordPress serving the dynamic content, WP Super Cache stores the result as a static HTML file.
steps.title: WP Super Cache works by using WordPress to pre-build every page of your website

steps.content:
WP Super Cache instructs the web-server to look first in the cached-website folder and serve that page directly

The entire WordPress application is completely bypassed!
steps.title: WP Super Cache instructs the web-server to look first in the cached-website folder and serve _that_ page directly

steps.content:
The web application is no longer relied upon for expensive conditional logic or database transactions

The cached version of the website is a static website because the web-server serves the cached page files to the user directly from the file-system.
steps.title: The web application is no longer relied upon for expensive conditional logic or database transactions

steps.content:
Serving a static website only requires the website's pages be pre-built and stored on the server's filesystem

The web-server can then serve these files directly.
steps.title: Serving a static website only requires the website's pages be pre-built and stored on the server's filesystem

steps.content:
Does the entire application even need to be on the server?

WP Super Cache runs WordPress on the server to pre-generate the website pages. But that means your server needs to run PHP and a MySQL database which is more costly and resource intensive than a static file server.
steps.title: Does the entire application even need to be on the server?

steps.content:
Web page files can be generated anywhere, then uploaded to the server

A static website generator is a program that generates static websites in a completely standalone way. There are many static website generator's made in a variety of programming languages.
steps.title: Web page files can be generated  _anywhere_, then uploaded to the server

steps.content:
Your personal computer can run Static website generators

But this implies your computer must be setup to run a programming language like PHP, Ruby, Javascript, and maybe even a database. This might not always be possible, especially for non-technical users.
steps.title: Your personal computer can run Static website generators

steps.content:
Static Website Generation as a Service

A static website generator service allows you to upload templates via their website which they process for you. You can use your own text-editor or web browser interface to edit and upload your templates to the service.
steps.title: Static Website Generation as a Service

steps.content: The website generation service publishes your site by uploading the generated files to a static file server for hosting
steps.title: The website generation service publishes your site by uploading the generated files to a static file server for hosting

steps.content: Static File Servers are extremely fast, can handle tons of traffic, and fail much less often
steps.title: Static File Servers are extremely fast, can handle tons of traffic, and fail much less often

steps.content:
Recap: Dynamic websites execute templates live on the server

This makes sense if your content needs to be live, or manage users, user sessions, access level controls, admin-panels, e-commerce, and so on.
steps.title: Recap: Dynamic websites execute templates live on the server

steps.content: Static websites get a huge performance boost from pre-generating the templates off-server
steps.title: Static websites get a huge performance boost from pre-generating the templates _off-server_

steps.content:
